image.altText: A sign saying 'Ashley Youth Detention Centre' outside some fencing.

props.synopsis: A plan to build five facilities with a "therapeutic" approach to youth detention — to fill the gap when Tasmania's Ashley youth prison closes — appears to have been placed on the backburner, with the minister insisting it's not about cost.

title.children: Ashley Youth prison replacement plan shelved as Tasmanian government looks to fund existing services

image.altText: A composite image of Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese, both wearing thick-rimmed glasses and looking stern.

props.synopsis: The reality of the Middle East conflict is that of an ever-widening fight between two terrorist organisations and an increasingly militant state that is ignoring international calls for restraint, including from its most powerful ally.

title.children: Peter Dutton says the PM has put Australia 'at odds' with its allies on Israel. The truth is far more complicated

image.altText: Australia's Parliament House in Canberra

props.synopsis: The NACC confirms it conducted a raid on the premises at Parliament House, saying its investigation does not relate to a current or former politician.

title.children: Corruption watchdog conducts raid at Parliament House in relation to 'ongoing investigation'

image.altText: A guy in a suit and tie sits in a room during an interview.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Labor party has endured four straight state election losses, surfacing from the latest with a new leader. Can Dean Winter turn that around?

title.children: Dean Winter has picked a lane — can he ride it to the next election?

image.altText: A balcony overlooking water.

props.synopsis: Queensland authorities are probing the fees residents are charged to sell retirement villas, following an ABC investigation into the multi-billion-dollar sector.

title.children: Retirement village residents say they have fallen victim to 'unethical' practices. One state government is going to probe the issue

image.altText: Joe Biden looks straight ahead with stern expression, holding one hand in a balled up fist

props.synopsis: The White House has been urged to speed up sharing of sensitive military technology with Australia, agreed under the AUKUS deal, so the nations can jointly develop future weapons.

title.children: Biden urged to speed up sensitive military exports to Australia over 'grave and imminent' China threat

image.altText: Anthony Albanese press conference

props.synopsis: Teens already on social media could be exempt from a ban under options being canvassed by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese.

title.children: PM opens the door to softer ban for teens on social media

props.synopsis: Ahmad Sadeghi made remarks on social media late last month, the day Hassan Nasrallah was killed in an Israeli air strike.

title.children: Kylie Moore-Gilbert, detained by Iran for two years, says 'inflammatory' ambassador should be expelled

image.altText: A man holds a bunch of bridles.

props.synopsis: An independent stewards panel charges leading Tasmanian harness trainer Ben Yole, his brother and two harness drivers under the Australian Harness Racing Rules.

title.children: Did you miss? 📣 Long-awaited racing stewards report charges leading horse trainer Ben Yole and others

image.altText: Flames coming out of a village at night.

props.synopsis: The US military says it conducted 15 strikes on Friday against targets linked to Iran-aligned Houthi fighters in Yemen, while an overnight Israeli air strike severed a major highway connecting Lebanon with Syria

title.children: US military says it hit 15 Houthi targets in Yemen, Israeli air strike hits key route out of Lebanon

image.altText: A gas flare on an oil production platform in the Soroush oil fields is seen alongside an Iranian flag in the Persian Gulf, Iran

props.synopsis: Global oil prices have been falling until increased geopolitical tensions in the Middle East saw jumps this week. So what does that mean for Australia in coming weeks?

title.children: What happened to global oil prices this week? What does it mean for Australia's petrol prices?

image.altText: Wind turbines are set to dot the landscape in Victoria's west

props.synopsis: Barely five months after the federal government committed more than $22 billion over 10 years to boost green hydrogen as an alternative fuel, two major projects have hit the skids.

title.children: Does green hydrogen have a future?

image.altText: A solar system on a rooftop at sunset.

props.synopsis: Solar businesses across the country are owed millions of dollars for work they have done as part of Australia's flagship green power scheme. But it's not customers owing them money. It's the middlemen, sitting at the heart of the financial plumbing behind it.

title.children: In the shadows of the billion-dollar solar industry, 'cowboys' are drawn to huge profits with little oversight

image.altText: A yellow Hezbollah flag, featuring an arm reaching up to a rifle, seen above a sea of people.

props.synopsis: Federal police have released the images of seven men they say may be able to assist an investigation related to ceasefire rallies in Melbourne last weekend.

title.children: AFP releases images of seven people as Hezbollah flag investigation continues

image.altText: Kharg island

props.synopsis: The US government once baulked at bombing Iran's Kharg Island over fears of a "worldwide oil crisis" — now Israel is weighing up an attack on its enemy's "oil lifeline".

title.children: The tiny Iranian island in Israel's sights

image.altText: Flood damaged properties are seen on Federation Drive in the suburb of Bray Park.

props.synopsis: Researchers have found 23,000 Australians over the age of 15 have been displaced by floods, bushfires or cyclones on average every year since 2009.

title.children: This couple is selling up after an unexpected flood, with new research predicting more to be displaced from extreme weather

image.altText: An artist's illustration shows an apartment complex full of activity.

props.synopsis: Artist renderings of public housing built by a proposed government-owned developer have been released by the Greens — as well as their $40 billion price tag.

title.children: The Greens say you could live in this 'beautiful' home, but the scheme would cost taxpayers $40b

image.altText: Ben Simmons in action for the Brooklyn Nets

props.synopsis: After a nightmare three-year run, Ben Simmons insists he is fit and firing ahead of the upcoming NBA season. Whether he is able to take to the court consistently will determine just how long his future in the game is.

title.children: 'I'm pretty good': Ben Simmons is talking tough, but needs his game to back it up to save his basketball career

image.altText: John Pesutto, David Southwick and Georgie Crozier at a press conference

props.synopsis: After a bruising three weeks of evidence in the Federal Court and grumblings of Liberal leadership tensions, should the opposition leader be concerned?

title.children: Secret recordings aired in a defamation trial might just reveal a trust problem in Victoria's Liberal Party

image.altText: A race horse being ridden by a jockey sprints towards the finish line near a large green sign reading: "Singapore Turf Club."

props.synopsis: Horseracing will end in Singapore when The Turf Club holds its last meet before handing its land back to the government to build apartments to help with housing affordability issues in the city-state, which has one of the most expensive property markets in the world.

title.children: Singapore real estate prices are so shocking, the city-state is bulldozing this racecourse for the land

image.altText: Mid shot of a woman and a man addressing the media.

props.synopsis: Against warnings from health, justice and Aboriginal groups, the NT government says it will fulfil its election promise and return the age of criminal responsibility back to 10 this year.

title.children: As advocates push to raise the criminal age to 14, the NT is lowering it to 10

image.altText: Aunty Tapua hopes the funding will resolve the water security issues, for the sake of the future of the community.

props.synopsis: The First Nations community of Cherbourg will receive $26 million to upgrade its water infrastructure, after years of substandard supply despite living just three hours' drive from Brisbane.

title.children: Community forced to buy in bottled water hopes new funds will finally fix town's E. coli-riddled supply

image.altText: Shane Smithers, in a beanie, paints intricate white lines on a large mural

props.synopsis: Shane's been in dozens of caves. He's never seen dots. So why are they the dominant Aboriginal visual language?

title.children: 'We didn't have dots': How Aboriginal visual language became homogenised

image.altText: A large four-metre crocodile sits on the sand bank.

props.synopsis: An online influencer has come under fire for boasting about feeding a four-metre crocodile in Far North Queensland just a month after penalties for interfering with the reptiles were drastically increased.

title.children: Influencer under investigation over wild croc feeding video

image.altText: Pauline David being lifted onto an accessible taxi

props.synopsis: Pauline David had to sleep in her wheelchair after an accessible taxi failed to arrive to take her home. She's one of many people with a disability struggling to maintain independence as the number of accessible cabs in NSW declines.

title.children: Pauline was forced to sleep in her wheelchair when an accessible taxi failed to turn up

image.altText: Tourists take photos amongst statues of the ancient temple.

props.synopsis: As the federal government pursues closer economic ties with Indonesia, studies of the country's language and culture are on the decline across Australia.

title.children: Uproar over elite private school's plan to axe Indonesian language studies

image.altText: A black and white cow.

props.synopsis: Everything is bigger in Texas, even bird flu amongst cattle. But while there are concerns for Australian dairy farmers they say things are in a state of alert rather than alarm.

title.children: 'Alert but not alarmed': Australian dairy farmers react to fears of deadly strain of bird flu

image.altText: A lady smiling for a selfie with a man on a horse behind her waving to the camera

props.synopsis: Being in a relationship doesn't mean you should feel guilty for travelling without your significant other. Here's why it can strengthen your bond.

title.children: 'Couples that do everything together, stay together.' Erin didn't let this stop her from travelling overseas solo

image.altText: A mum pushing her daughter on the swing

props.synopsis: The threat of lead contamination is just about everywhere in Port Pirie. It means the burden of protecting children, who are more at risk of poisoning, falls to parents.

title.children: Parents raising children near lead smelter fear fight against health impacts is 'a losing battle'

image.altText: A for sale sign out the front of an apartment building.

props.synopsis: We asked three experts for their tips to first home buyers. This is what they said.

title.children: House prices are on the rise but these experts say there's still room for first home buyers

image.altText: NT Children's Commissioner Shahleena Musk sitting in chair being interviewed for TV.

props.synopsis: In an interview with Stateline, NT Children's Commissioner Shahleena Musk says the government's plan to lower the age of criminal responsibility from 12 to 10 will only entrench cycles of disadvantage and increase the number of violent adult criminals in the territory's justice system.

title.children: NT children's commissioner says lowering criminal age to 10 will increase violent offending

image.altText: A Pakistan fielder leaps in the air in celebration as a batter looks on at the Women's T20 World Cup.

props.synopsis: The ninth Women's T20 World Cup gets underway in the United Arab Emirates, with wins to Pakistan and Bangladesh in Sharjah.

title.children: Pakistan beats Sri Lanka, Bangladesh beats Scotland as Women's T20 World Cup gets underway

image.altText: Vance and Walz shake hands.

props.synopsis: Time to test how much attention you've been paying to the news!

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A Veep off, a Haka record, and the surprising place to find cheap groceries
